column5: Hey folks,  Heading up for the May long weekend 19th-22nd. Just wondering if anyone has been there or has any feedback?  $495 including boat, food, bait, etc...seems like a great deal for that weekend!  We'll be targeting walleye and pike.  Thanks, really excited about it! Kevin
All I can say is to bring worms.  I know most of us like to use artificial baits, but the worms will help if the bite is slow. Oh yeah, have fun!
Great Lodge, Steve is a gracious host. You'll love the place, especially if you play guitar! Can't help you with the fishing as I've only fished there for Muskie.
thats a great price,especially if it is canadian dollars. i've seen some of the tv shows that have taken place there, looks like a great spot.
All I can say is to bring worms.  I know most of us like to use artificial baits, but the worms will help if the bite is slow. Oh yeah, have fun! X2 and bring minnows as well.
personal experience fishing pointe au baril  in the spring the fish wont hit a minnow they only want worms...it the fall, the fish wont eat a worm all they want are minnows.
Heading to Chaudiere as well first week in June.............Ill be following this thread to see your results
Hey sounds great -- we'll post upon returning.  Appreciate the feedback, thank you!  Kevin

My son and I stayed there had a good time . We fished Muskies but caught several nice Walleyes and Pike on our Muskie lures . We also stayed at the Lunge Lodge a couple trips its not to far from Chaudiere Lodge . Have a good trip .
